Title: 99th Regional Support Command Uses LED Lighting to Capture Significant Savings
Description: Describes how the Army Reserve 99th Regional Support Command cut energy consumption in half at the Support Command's Technical Sergeant Vernon McGarity Army Reserve Center by replacing more than 1,200 fluorescent troffers with LED troffers with dimmers.

Title: Air Force Achieves Fuel Efficiency Through Industry Best Practices
Description: Overview of the U.S. Air Force's fuel-efficiency program.

Title: Air Handler Condensate Recovery at the Environmental Protection Agency's Science and Ecosystem Support Division
Description: Details the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) decision to address water conservation and management for its Science and Ecosystem Support Division due to a severe drought.

Title: Alcatraz Island
Description: Details a solar-powered microgrid on the main cell house building which integrated with diesel generators to power the island.

Title: Ames Research Center Success Story
Description: Details how the National Aeronautics and Space Administration achieved over $1 million in one-time utility incentives and rebates by launching a utility energy service contract.

Title: Army Reserve 63d RSC Achieves 85% Savings in Parking Lot Lighting
Description: Describes how the Army Reserve 63d Regional Support Command achieved 85% energy savings and $4,000 per year in cost savings by replacing 12 old light fixtures with light-emitting diode fixtures in the military equipment parking area.

Title: An Exemplary Earth Day Event: NIST Ribbon-Cutting Event for Solar PV Project under FEMP's ESPC ENABLE Program
Description: Details how the project represents an economical clean energy solution that reduces government energy costs.

Title: Aspinall Courthouse: GSA's Historic Preservation and Net-Zero Renovation
Description: Overview of GSA's decision to align historic preservation renovations with zero energy goals in the Wayne N. Aspinall Federal Building and U.S. Courthouse in Grand Junction, Colorado.

Title: Biscayne National Park
Description: Describes a 15-kW PV system which replaced two 60-kW diesel generators, reducing the need for fuel transport.

Title: Blue Ridge Parkway
Description: Describes a 1,560-kW PV system includes 300 safety lights, which provided lighting for nighttime visitors and improve site visibility throughout the day.

Title: Boiler Combustion Control and Monitoring System
Description: Details how system operating costs were reduced over the baseline and over existing state-of-the-art combustion control technology.

Title: Boiler Upgrades and Decentralizing Steam Systems Save Water and Energy at Naval Air Station Oceana
Description: Details Naval Air Station Oceana findings that its heating needs could be met more efficiently by replacing its central plant with a combination of distributed boilers and ground source heat pumps.

Title: Bureau of Land Management ESPC Across Six States
Description: Describes how the U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI) Bureau of Land Management (BLM) successfully implemented an energy savings performance contract (ESPC) with Johnson Controls, Inc., to implement energy efficiency improvements at remote BLM sites in six western states.
Location: CO; ID; MT; NV; OR; WY

Title: Byron G. Rogers Federal Building Harvests Daylight and Super Savings
Description: Describes how the Byron G. Rogers Federal Building replaced existing T12 and T8 luminaires with LED dedicated troffers with advanced controls.

Title: Camp Pendleton Saves 91% in Parking Lot Lighting
Description: Describes how Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton replaced high-pressure sodium fixtures in one parking lot with high-efficiency induction fixtures for energy and cost savings.

Title: Case Study: Evaluating Liquid Versus Air Cooling in the Maui High-Performance Computing Center
Description: Evaluates the energy efficiency of a liquid-cooled computing system applied in a retrofit project at this U.S. Department of Defense (DOD) installation.

Title: Case Study: Innovative Energy Efficiency Approaches in NOAA's Environmental Security Computing Center in Fairmont, West Virginia
Description: Summarizes three data centers evaluated for potential energy efficiency improvements in this National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) computing center.

Title: Case Study: Mobile Photovoltaic System at Bechler Meadows Ranger Station, Yellowstone National Park
Description: Describes the performance of a mobile photovoltaic system installed in 2011 to provide power to Bechler Ranger Station in Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming.

Title: Case Study: Opportunities to Improve Energy-Efficiency in Three Federal Data Centers
Description: Details three data centers Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory (LBNL) evaluated for potential energy-efficiency improvements.

Title: Channel Islands National Park
Description: Details two wind turbines and several PV systems which provided power to facilities on Santa Cruz, Santa Rosa, and San Miguel islands.

Title: Charles McC. Mathias Laboratory Smithsonian Environmental Research Center
Description: Details the integrated design and operation of sustainable energy, water, and material systems into the Charles McC. Mathias Laboratory.

Title: Chickasaw National Recreation Area
Description: Describes the solar hot water system which provided water to comfort stations at a consistent temperature of 105°F.

Title: Comprehensive Energy Program at Patrick Air Force Base Set to Exceed Energy Goals
Description: Focuses on Patrick Air Force Base's use of a utility energy services contract to achieve its energy goals.

Title: Connecting Sustainability to the Agency's Mission
Description: Fact sheet describes a case study on the USFW Energy Management Program's mission to increase energy awareness and efficiency through various projects funded through the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act.

Title: Crater Lake National Park
Description: Describes how PV panels provide power to Crater Lake's North Entrance Fee Station, which has no connection to a commercial power source.

Title: Data, Feedback, and Awareness Lead to Big Energy Savings
Description: Describes how the Navy Region Southwest Metro San Diego Area regional energy management team achieved significant energy savings at the Naval Base Coronado, Naval Base San Diego, and Naval Base Point Loma.

Title: Death Valley National Park
Description: Details how the remodeled visitor center includes a 60-kW PV shade structure array and a 30-kW field array near the headquarters parking lot.

Title: Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center, San Francisco, California
Description: Tells how the Veterans Affairs (VA) Medical Center in San Francisco is saving almost 3 million kilowatt-hours of electricity, more than 70,000 therms of natural gas, and more than $500,000 annually.

Title: Doing Time Under the Sun: Rooftop Photovoltaics
Description: Describes a 307-kilowatt photovoltaic system on Alcatraz Island.
Category: Energy-Efficient Products and Technologies; Distributed Energy

Title: Driving Operational Changes Through an Energy Monitoring System
Description: Describes a case study of IBM's corporate energy efficiency monitoring program that focuses on basic improvements in its real estate operations.

Title: Dyess Air Force Base Water Conservation and Green Energy
Description: Describes the successful water conservation energy savings performance contract project implemented at the Dyess Air Force Base in Texas.

Title: Enabling Sustainable Acquisition by Improving Procurement Systems
Description: Describes the DOE Waste Pilot Plant project.

Title: Energy Efficiency Opportunities in Federal High-Performance Computing Data Centers
Description: Describes energy efficiency opportunities in several DOD high-performance computing data centers.

Title: Energy Savings Performance Contracts Success Story—Northern California TRACON
Description: Details how DOE's Federal Energy Management Program (FEMP) training helped Northern California TRACON complete a successful project using an energy savings performance contract.

Title: ESPC ESA Case Study: Energy Affordability at the National Institute of Standards and Technology
Description: Describes how the U.S. Department of Commerce National Institute of Standards and Technology installed a 5 MW-DC photovoltaic system under an energy savings performance contract energy sales agreement.
Category: Distributed Energy; Energy Savings Performance Contracts

Title: Evaluation of Side Stream Filtration Technology at Oak Ridge National Laboratory
Description: Provides an in-depth look at side stream filtration at Oak Ridge National Laboratory.

Title: Food and Drug Administration White Oak Campus Environmental Stewardship and Cost Savings
Description: Describes FDA's White Oak Campus combined heat and power plant that was constructed using an energy savings performance contract.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: Fume Hood Sash Stickers Increases Laboratory Safety and Efficiency at Minimal Cost
Description: Describes two University of California campuses that increased laboratory exhaust efficiency and safety by using fume hood sash stickers.

Title: General Services Administration New Carrollton Federal Building
Description: How deep energy retrofits were achieved through a $45 million energy savings performance contract designed to reduce energy consumption by 60%.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: Glacier National Park
Description: Features the visitor center south of the Canadian border using electricity generated by 3.6 kW of PV and micro-hydroelectric power from an on-site dam.

Title: Grand Canyon National Park
Description: Details the 1.44-kW PV system on the remote North Rim of the park providing 50% of the power to the visitor center.

Title: Harold Washington Social Security Administration (SSA) Center Water Conservation and Green Energy
Description: Describes the success story on environmental stewardship and cost savings at the Harold Washington Social Security Administration (SSA) Center in Chicago, Illinois.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: Hill Air Force Base
Description: Energy savings performance contracting at Hill Air Force Base generated much interest during a recent training session on energy management that downlinked 12 DOD sites.

Title: Holistic Energy Management Yields Cost Savings and Resilience Benefits for the U.S. Coast Guard Academy
Description: Fact sheet details the overdue overhaul of the U.S. Coast Guard’s third largest energy consumer, the 86-year-old Coast Guard Academy in New London, Connecticut. The overhaul was made possible by the largest utility energy service contract (UESC) in U.S. Department of Homeland Security history.

Title: Honeywell Helps Deliver Resiliency and Cost Savings to Food and Drug Administration's White Oak Campus
Description: Describes the Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) multiphase energy savings performance contract project with Honeywell.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: IRS Parking Facility Lighting Retrofit Reduces Annual Energy Use by 76%
Description: Document provides an overview of how the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and MC Realty Group, its property management firm, achieved a 76% reduction in lighting energy use at an IRS facility parking garage in Kansas City, Missouri.

Title: Isle Royale National Park
Description: Describes an ESPC-funded sustainability and solar PV project including 91.8-kW and 42.1-kW PV arrays paired with diesel generators to handle seasonal loads.

Title: Kitchen Appliance Upgrades Improve Water Efficiency at U.S. Department of Defense Exchange Facilities
Description: Details DOD's Exchange, which took a leadership role in kitchen appliance upgrades to improve water efficiency by integrating water efficiency concepts into the organization's overall sustainability plan and objectives.

Title: Lake Mead National Recreation Area
Description: Details the PV system at the Alan Bible Visitor Center designed to handle 90% of power needs from April through October.

Title: LED Provides Effective and Efficient Parking Area Lighting at the NAVFAC Engineering Service Center
Description: Details new lighting technology that reduces energy consumption and reduces maintenance, while providing effective illumination.

Title: Leveraging Lighting for Energy Savings: GSA Northwest/Arctic Region
Description: Describes how the Northwest/Arctic Region branch of GSA improved safety and energy efficiency in its Fairbanks Federal Building parking garage.

Title: Magnetic-Bearing Chiller Compressors
Description: Shows independent analysis by the U.S. Navy that verifies magnetic bearing compressors operate more efficiently than reciprocating and screw compressors.

Title: Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton
Description: Details how a comprehensive effort cut energy use by 44% at U.S. Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton in California.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: Marine Corps Base Quantico Achieves 85% Savings in Parking Lighting
Description: Overview of how Marine Corps Base Quantico achieved 85% energy savings in parking lighting at one of its parking lots as part of a major overhaul of its outdoor lighting while boosting safety and security throughout the site.

Title: Mesa Verde National Park
Description: Details on-site renewable energy systems providing 95% of building energy requirements, and park staff plan to achieve net zero energy operations.

Title: Marine Corps Air Station (MCAS) Miramar
Description: Demonstrates the islanding capability of a 250-kW battery storage and 230-kW PV microgrid system at the installation’s Public Works building.

Title: Mojave National Preserve
Description: Details the 42-kW PV system (with 11-kWh batteries) that provided 100% of the power to the visitor center.

Title: NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center Improves Cooling System Performance
Description: Details Marshall Space Flight Center's innovative technologies to improve water efficiency and cooling performance for one of its problematic cooling systems.

Title: NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center Saves Water with High-Efficiency Toilet and Urinal Program
Description: Details Marshall Space Flight Center's innovative replacement program for toilets and urinals by researching appropriate fixtures, demonstrating technologies, and creating specifications for high-efficiency fixtures.

Title: National Aeronautical and Space Administration Johnson Space Flight Center
Description: Describes how the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) will save approximately $43 million in facility operations costs over the next 23 years at the Johnson Space Flight Center in Houston, Texas.

Title: National Archives and Records Administration Archives II Building
Description: Describes a 500-kW rooftop PV and 225-kW cogeneration system that offsets energy consumption at NARA’s largest and most energy-intensive building.

Title: National Park Service Statue of Liberty National Monument
Description: Focuses on infrastructure improvements with the addition of energy-efficient lighting, variable-speed drives, and installation of energy management control systems.

Title: Natural Bridges National Monument
Description: Describes the PV system providing 100% of the site’s power. The site was previously served by diesel generators, and fuel deliveries were very costly.

Title: Net Zero Pilot Program Lights the Path to Big Savings in Guam
Description: Describes how the Army Reserve 9th Mission Support Command reduced lighting energy consumption by replacing over 400 fluorescent troffers with LED troffers.

Title: New Carrollton Federal Building Lighting Retrofit Captures Cool Savings
Description: Describes how the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) cut its annual lighting electric bill by upgrading fluorescent lighting to a new LED troffer lighting and controls system in the New Carrollton Federal Building in Lanham, Maryland.

Title: NSIDC Data Center: Energy Reduction Strategies
Description: Describes the Green Data Center Project efforts to significantly reduce the energy use of the National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC).

Title: O&M Best Practices for Small-Scale Photovoltaic Systems Success Story
Description: Details how DOE FEMP training helped federal energy and facility management professionals complete successful photovoltaics projects.

Title: Ravalli Electric Cooperative Teams up with Trapper Creek Job Corp to Create Impressive Energy Savings
Description: Describes how Ravalli Electric Cooperative helped the U.S. Department of Labor's (DOL) Trapper Creek Job Corp learn how to be more energy-efficient.

Title: Reducing Data Center Loads for a Large-Scale, Net Zero Office Building
Description: Describes the design, implementation strategies, and continuous performance monitoring of the National Renewable Energy Laboratory's (NREL) Research Support Facility data center.

Title: Retro-Commissioning Increases Data Center Efficiency at Low Cost
Description: Discusses a successful retro-commissioning project at the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Savannah River Site to increase data center energy efficiency at low costs.

Title: Reverse Osmosis Optimization
Description: Assesses techniques for optimizing reverse osmosis (RO) systems to increase RO system performance and water efficiency.

Title: Rock the Watt: An Energy Conservation Campaign at Pacific Northwest National Lab
Description: Describes Pacific Northwest National Laboratory's three-month Rock the Watt campaign to reduce energy use at its main campus in Richland, Washington.

Title: Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area
Description: Details how a geothermal cooling system providing about 80% of hot water needs, and a back-up system is powered by the solar PV carports.

Title: Thomas E. Creek Medical Center
Description: Describes a 2.28-MW PV covered parking project at the Thomas E. Creek VA Medical Center that provides about 30% of the center’s electricity.

Title: U.S. Army Reserve 88th Readiness Division Finds Big Savings
Description: Features the U.S. Army Reserve 88th Readiness Division, which was recognized in two 2017 Interior Lighting Campaign exemplary recognition categories.

Title: U.S. Coast Guard and Florida Power and Light Successfully Implement a Multi-Site UESC Project
Description: Details a multi-site utility energy service contract project between the United States Coast Guard and Florida Power and Light.

Title: U.S. Coast Guard Yard Analysis of Microgrid to Reduce Onsite Generation Curtailment
Description: Fact sheet details the U.S. Coast Guard Yard energy savings performance contract project to install four 1-MW reciprocating generators that ran off landfill gas.

Title: U.S. Coast Guard, Kodiak Island, Alaska
Description: Describes how the Coast Guard is saving more than $220,000 a year in energy costs at its facility at Kodiak Island, Alaska.

Title: U.S. Department of Energy Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory
Description: Describes how DOE's Fermilab upgraded the centralized cooling system and separated the system into two segments.

Title: U.S. Department of Energy Headquarters Lighting Retrofit
Description: Describes an energy savings performance contract lighting upgrade project at the James Forrestal Building, which serves as headquarters for the U.S. Department of Energy in Washington, D.C.

Title: U.S. Department of Energy Pantex Plant
Description: Details DOE Pantex Plant's savings of approximately $10.4 million in energy-related costs over 18 years.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: U.S. Department of the Interior Bureau of Indian Affairs Sherman Indian School
Description: Details how DOI's Bureau of Indian Affairs reduced energy costs by replacing inefficient lighting and aging building equipment, and installing renewable energy systems without huge budget increases.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service Moves Toward Net-Zero Buildings
Description: Overview of the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFW) net-zero energy visitor's center at the Assabet River National Wildlife.

Title: U.S. Forest Service's Power-IT-Down Program
Description: Describes the U.S. Forest Service's Power-IT-Down Program, which strongly encouraged employees to shut off their computers when leaving the office.

Title: U.S. Marine Corps Stand at Forefront of Energy and Water Savings
Description: Overview of the U.S. Marine Corps Beaufort Air Station's energy and water savings accomplishments.

Title: U.S. Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba
Description: Describes environmental stewardship and cost savings at the U.S. Naval Station at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.
Category: Energy Savings Performance Contracts; Distributed Energy

Title: U.S. Postal Service General Mail Facility, San Diego, California
Description: Details how the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) was the first Federal agency to award a shared energy savings contract (now known as an energy savings performance contract).

Title: University of California Irvine Smart Labs Initiative
Description: Covers a DOE Better Buildings Challenge partner that achieved 60% energy savings through dynamic, intelligent heating, cooling, and air-conditioning technologies.

Title: USDA and Florida Power & Light Company Successfully Save $85K/year with UESC Collaboration
Description: Features the U.S. Department of Agriculture's (USDA) Miami Subtropical Horticulture Research Station, which was in need of several energy upgrades.

Title: Using Thermosyphon Hybrid Cooling System to Optimize Data Center Water Efficiency
Description: Describes a Federal Energy Management Program Federal Energy and Water Management Award-winning project that deployed an innovative thermosyphon cooler (TSC) as a test bed on the roof of the National Renewable Energy Laboratory's Energy Systems Integration Facility (ESIF).

Title: USPS: Lean Green Teams
Description: Fact sheet describes a case study on the Lean Green Teams.

Title: Variable Speed Fan Retrofits for Computer Room Air Conditioners
Description: Describes various concepts for more cost-effective cooling solutions in data centers, while keeping in mind that the reliability of computing systems and their respective cooling systems is always a key criterion.

Title: Veteran's Affairs Health Care System, West Haven, Connecticut
Description: Describes how the West Haven Campus of the VA Connecticut Health Care System was the first veteran's hospital to award a shared energy savings contract (now known as an energy savings performance contract).

Title: Water Efficiency Improvements at Various U.S. Environmental Protection Agency Sites
Description: Case study discusses EPA's successful water conservation program, which reduced potable water use through a series of initiatives at EPA laboratories.

Title: Wireless Sensor Networks for Data Centers
Description: This case study shows how wireless sensor technology provides a cost-effective and facilities-friendly way of helping data center operators visualize and implement system changes that reduce overall energy consumption.

Title: Wireless Sensors Improve Data Center Efficiency
Description: Describes how to improve data center energy efficiency for wireless sensors, and how to use that information to manage the data center.

Title: Yellowstone National Park
Description: Details how a PV and battery storage system provides 100% of Bechler Ranger Station's power. The site was previously served by a propane tank.
